intro: Apostrophes can be super pesky to deal with, especially when it comes to plural possessives and words or names like “James” that end in “s.” Is it okay to just add a single apostrophe at the end, or should you add an apostrophe and an “s” to the word? We’ve answered all your questions below so you can become an apostrophe expert.

points.name: Do you say James’ or James’s?

steps.title: Both James’ and James’s are grammatically correct.
steps.subtitle: Certain academic writing styles prefer one version over the other, but it doesn’t matter which one you use in your regular, written English. Both of the following examples are correct:
sub-points: James’ dog is the cutest little thing ever.
Did you see Mr. James’s new car?
